inference:
There are 3 ways to earn $1700.

(1) $$$1000 + $500 + $200 = $1700

(2) $$$500 + $500 + $700 = $1700

(3) $$$300 + $700 + $700 = $1700

The probability of exactly $$$1700$ in three spins is the sum of these three probabilities.

So, the numerator is:
$$1\cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} + 1\cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} + 1\cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} \cdot \frac{1}{5} = 3\cdot \frac{1}{125}$$

The probability of landing on any region is 1/5, and there are 5 regions.

So, the denominator is:
$$5\cdot 5\cdot 5 = 125$$

Thus, the probability is:
$$\frac{3}{125}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$\frac{3}{125}$. I hope it is correct.}
ground_truth: There are five slots on which the spinner can land with each spin; thus, there are 125 total possibilities with three spins. The only way in which you can earn exactly $ \$ 1700$ in three spins is by landing on a $ \$ 300$, a $ \$ 400$, and a $ \$ 1000$. You could land on any one of the three in your first spin, any one of the remaining two in your second spin, and the remaining one in your last spin, so there are $3 \cdot 2 \cdot 1 = 6$ ways in which you can earn $ \$ 1700$. Thus, the probability is $\boxed{\frac{6}{125}}$.
